result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Khue Yang

records.addlTxt:
Invoice from Interpreter Lee Yang dated 10/12/22 for services rendered on 10/10/22
sent to fiscal clerk on 10/13/22 sp
No contact with the victims listed in the complaint, K.T. and K.Y.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

9:30 AM 
Defendant Khue Yang in court.  Attorney Jerod Barkley in court for Khue Yang.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls the case and states appearances.
Parties are ready to proceed.
Atty Barkley makes statements regarding the motion before the court and provides argument in favor of modification of bond.

Interpreter Lee Yang is sworn in by the clerk.
Victim (defendant's father) makes a statement and requests that the no contact be removed.
Court questions the victim.
Victim notes that he has no fear of contact with the defendant.
Victim is excused.
Interpreter is excused.

Atty Brian Pfeil makes statements in opposition to a portion of the motion to modify bond.
Atty Pfeil notes that there is no objection to the no contact being lifted, as long as the defendant is in custody.
Atty Barkley makes statements regarding an allegation made against the defendant.

Court states findings.

BY THE COURT:
Bond to remain at $250,000.
Motion to modify bond to allow contact with P.Y. is granted.
All other conditions to remain the same.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.
Filed by Prosecutor.

3:24 PM Defendant Khue Yang in court, in custody. Attorney Jerod Barkley in court for Khue Yang.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the need for a court reporter.
Atty Barkley informs the court that it is the defendant's father who would need an interpreter at the upcoming motion hearing.
State calls officer Garthman who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Witness identifies the defendant in court at the defense table.
Cross exam by Atty Barkley.
No further witnesses.
Atty Barkley request not to find probable cause as to count 4.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

1:18 PM Defendant Khue Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Reckless Armed with weapon and Criminal Damage.
